jx.jx_en_mean: To finish or dispose of quickly and easily.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 迅速地完成：很快且轻易地做完或抛掉

lj.lj_ly: they polished off most of the sausages.
lj.lj_ls: 他们很快吃掉了大部分香肠。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French poliss-, lengthened stem of polir 'to polish', from Latin polire

entry.def: Polish is a substance that you put on the surface of an object in order to clean it, protect it, and make it shine.

example.ex: The still air smelt faintly of furniture polish.
example.tran: 凝滞的空气中隐隐有股家具上光剂的味道。
肥皂粉、洗涤剂和擦亮剂

entry.def: If you polish something, you put polish on it or rub it with a cloth to make it shine.

example.ex: Each morning he shaved and polished his shoes...
example.tran: 他每天早晨都刮脸、擦鞋。

example.ex: He removed his glasses and began polishing them with his handkerchief.
example.tran: 他摘下眼镜，开始用手帕擦拭。

entry.def: If you say that someone has polish, you mean that they show confidence and know how to behave socially.
If you say that a performance or piece of work has polish, you mean that it is of a very high standard.

example.ex: The opera lacks the polish of his later work.
example.tran: 这部歌剧不及他晚期作品娴熟。

entry.def: If you polish your technique, performance, or skill at doing something, you work on improving it.

example.ex: They just need to polish their technique.
example.tran: 他们只是需要改进一下技巧。

means.word_mean: 1. the property of being smooth and shiny
2. a highly developed state of perfection; having a flawless or impeccable quality;

sentences.sentence: "I admired the exquisite refinement of his prose"
"almost an inspiration which gives to all work that finish which is almost art"--Joseph Conrad

means.word_mean: 2. improve or perfect by pruning or polishing;
3. bring to a highly developed, finished, or refined state;

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"像……一样,有……的",通常放在具体的名词后; 2. 表动词,"造成……,成……"

stems_affixes.word_buile: slug懒汉+ish像……一样,有……的→sluggish→行动迟钝的,缓慢的
book书+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.书呆子的
boor粗野的人,不懂礼貌的人+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.粗野的
child孩子+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.孩子的;幼稚的
churl粗野的人,吝啬鬼+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.脾气暴躁的
cold冷+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.微冷的
colt小马,无经验的年轻人+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.放浪不拘的,似小马的
fadd时尚+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.流行一时的,时尚的
fat非,胖+ish像……一样,有……的→fattish略胖的
fiend魔鬼+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.极凶恶的
fool愚人,白痴+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.愚笨的,愚蠢的
mode时尚+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.时髦的
self自己+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.自私的
snob势利的人,假内行+ish像……一样,有……的→snobbish势利的,谄上欺下的
wag摇摆,小丑+ish像……一样,有……的→waggish→诙谐的,滑稽的
yellow黄+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.微黄色的
pol擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,擦亮;使优美,润饰 n.擦光剂,上光蜡
di分开+mini小+ish造成……,成……→变小,减少
em进入+bell美好+ish造成……,成……→进入美好→装饰
fam饿+ish造成……,成……→v.使饥饿
flour花+ish造成……,成……→v.繁荣,茂盛;挥舞
furb擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,刷新
im进入+pover贫困+ish造成……,成……→v.使成赤贫
pol擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,擦亮;使优美,润饰 n.擦光剂,上光蜡
vanqu克服+ish造成……,成……→v.征服,击溃

Sentence.sentence: It is a language that has its origin in ancient Polish.
It was created by Ludwig Lazar Zamenhof, a Polish Jewish doctor specialized in eye diseases

sentences.en: Would you please polish my article right now?
sentences.cn: 您现在把我的文章润色一下好吗?

sentences.en: If you polish the article, we will print it in the newspaper.
sentences.cn: 如果你把这篇文章润色一下，我们就在报纸上发表它。

means.word_mean: 光泽剂, 上光蜡, 亮漆，擦光剂，上光剂， 亮光剂

sentences.cn: 热盘子会弄坏桌面的光泽。

means.word_mean: 擦亮, 磨光，抛光，上光

sentences.en: Use brown polish on these shoes.
sentences.cn: 用棕色的鞋油擦这双鞋。

means.word_mean: 优美, 高雅, 完善，品味，礼貌

sentences.en: His writing has potential but lacks polish.
sentences.cn: 他的写作很有潜力, 但是不够优美。
